createEscrow(uint256,uint256,address,uin.details: Deploys a new Escrow contract and adds it to the registry

params.depositAmount: The amount each participant must deposit
params.expiry: The timestamp when the escrow expires
params.oracle: The address of the oracle that controls the escrow
params.oracleFee: The oracle fee in basis points (max 10000 = 100%)
params.paymentToken: The address of the payment token to use for this escrow
params.paymentTokenDecimals: The number of decimal places for the payment token

returns._0: address The address of the newly created escrow contract  This function creates a new Escrow contract with the provided parameters. Each escrow can use a different payment token, providing flexibility for different use cases. The caller becomes the "host" of the escrow (tracked in the event).  Requirements: - expiry must be in the future - paymentToken must not be the zero address - oracle must not be the zero address - depositAmount must be greater than 0 - oracleFee must not exceed 10000 (100%)  Emits an {EscrowCreated} event
escrows Array of all Escrow contract addresses created by this factory

createEscrow(uint256,uint256,address,uin.notice: Creates a new Escrow contract with the specified parameters

escrows(uint256).notice: Array of all created Escrow contracts
